greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the asymptotic density of numbers whose number of divisors is a power of 2 (A036537).
link: Vladimir Shevelev, S-exponential numbers, Acta Arithmetica, Vol. 175, No. 4 (2016), pp. 385-395, alternative link.
mathematica: $MaxExtraPrecision = 1000; m = 1000; em = 10; f[x_] := Log[(1 - x)*(1 + Sum[x^(2^e - 1), {e, 1, em}])]; c = Rest[CoefficientList[Series[f[x], {x, 0, m}], x] * Range[0, m]]; RealDigits[Exp[NSum[Indexed[c, k]*PrimeZetaP[k]/k, {k, 2, m}, NSumTerms -> m, WorkingPrecision -> m]], 10, 100][[1]]
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 27 2019
